original_title: Fuel quota to increase in August?
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); Fuel quotas will be further increased next month after evaluation, announced Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera on Thursday (20).
In 2022, Sri Lanka introduced the 'National Fuel Pass', a fuel rationing scheme due to the shortage of fuel in the country.
National Fuel Pass was developed with the assistance of leading tech companies in Sri Lanka and the Institute of Communication and Information Technology (ICTA).
The Power and Energy Minister said that the fuel cargo plan & supply for the next 6 months were reviewed with the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation.

He said that fuel import plans, refinery operations, refinery upgrade proposals, QR quotas, storage capacity, stock automation, agreements with fuel stations, and distribution were reviewed and discussed.
